speaker: YORK
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: YORK
text_entry: SCENE I. Saint Alban's.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter KING HENRY VI, QUEEN MARGARET, GLOUCESTER, CARDINAL, and SUFFOLK, with Falconers halloing

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Believe me, lords, for flying at the brook,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I saw not better sport these seven years' day:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Yet, by your leave, the wind was very high;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And, ten to one, old Joan had not gone out.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But what a point, my lord, your falcon made,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And what a pitch she flew above the rest!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To see how God in all his creatures works!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Yea, man and birds are fain of climbing high.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No marvel, an it like your majesty,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: My lord protector's hawks do tower so well;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: They know their master loves to be aloft,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And bears his thoughts above his falcon's pitch.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My lord, 'tis but a base ignoble mind

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That mounts no higher than a bird can soar.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: I thought as much; he would be above the clouds.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, my lord cardinal? how think you by that?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Were it not good your grace could fly to heaven?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The treasury of everlasting joy.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Thy heaven is on earth; thine eyes and thoughts

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Beat on a crown, the treasure of thy heart;

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Pernicious protector, dangerous peer,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: That smooth'st it so with king and commonweal!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, cardinal, is your priesthood grown peremptory?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Tantaene animis coelestibus irae?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Churchmen so hot? good uncle, hide such malice;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With such holiness can you do it?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No malice, sir; no more than well becomes

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So good a quarrel and so bad a peer.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As who, my lord?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Why, as you, my lord,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: An't like your lordly lord-protectorship.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why, Suffolk, England knows thine insolence.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And thy ambition, Gloucester.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I prithee, peace, good queen,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And whet not on these furious peers;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For blessed are the peacemakers on earth.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Let me be blessed for the peace I make,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Against this proud protector, with my sword!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Aside to CARDINAL]  Faith, holy uncle, would

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: 'twere come to that!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: [Aside to GLOUCESTER]  Marry, when thou darest.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Aside to CARDINAL]  Make up no factious

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: numbers for the matter;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In thine own person answer thy abuse.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: [Aside to GLOUCESTER]  Ay, where thou darest

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: not peep: an if thou darest,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: This evening, on the east side of the grove.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: How now, my lords!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Believe me, cousin Gloucester,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Had not your man put up the fowl so suddenly,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: We had had more sport.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Aside to GLOUCESTER

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Come with thy two-hand sword.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: True, uncle.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: [Aside to GLOUCESTER]  Are ye advised? the

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: east side of the grove?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Aside to CARDINAL]  Cardinal, I am with you.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Why, how now, uncle Gloucester!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Talking of hawking; nothing else, my lord.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Aside to CARDINAL

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now, by God's mother, priest, I'll shave your crown for this,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or all my fence shall fail.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: [Aside to GLOUCESTER]  Medice, teipsum--

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Protector, see to't well, protect yourself.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The winds grow high; so do your stomachs, lords.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: How irksome is this music to my heart!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: When such strings jar, what hope of harmony?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I pray, my lords, let me compound this strife.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Enter a Townsman of Saint Alban's, crying 'A miracle!'

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What means this noise?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Fellow, what miracle dost thou proclaim?

speaker: Townsman
text_entry: A miracle! a miracle!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Come to the king and tell him what miracle.

speaker: Townsman
text_entry: Forsooth, a blind man at Saint Alban's shrine,

speaker: Townsman
text_entry: Within this half-hour, hath received his sight;

speaker: Townsman
text_entry: A man that ne'er saw in his life before.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Now, God be praised, that to believing souls

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Gives light in darkness, comfort in despair!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Enter the Mayor of Saint Alban's and his  brethren, bearing SIMPCOX, between two in a chair, SIMPCOX's Wife following

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Here comes the townsmen on procession,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: To present your highness with the man.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Great is his comfort in this earthly vale,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Although by his sight his sin be multiplied.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Stand by, my masters: bring him near the king;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: His highness' pleasure is to talk with him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Good fellow, tell us here the circumstance,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That we for thee may glorify the Lord.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What, hast thou been long blind and now restored?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Born blind, an't please your grace.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Ay, indeed, was he.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: What woman is this?

speaker: Wife
text_entry: His wife, an't like your worship.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hadst thou been his mother, thou couldst have

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: better told.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Where wert thou born?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: At Berwick in the north, an't like your grace.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Poor soul, God's goodness hath been great to thee:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Let never day nor night unhallow'd pass,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: But still remember what the Lord hath done.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Tell me, good fellow, camest thou here by chance,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Or of devotion, to this holy shrine?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: God knows, of pure devotion; being call'd

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: A hundred times and oftener, in my sleep,

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: By good Saint Alban; who said, 'Simpcox, come,

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Come, offer at my shrine, and I will help thee.'

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Most true, forsooth; and many time and oft

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Myself have heard a voice to call him so.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: What, art thou lame?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Ay, God Almighty help me!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How camest thou so?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: A fall off of a tree.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: A plum-tree, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: How long hast thou been blind?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Born so, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What, and wouldst climb a tree?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: But that in all my life, when I was a youth.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Too true; and bought his climbing very dear.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Mass, thou lovedst plums well, that wouldst

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: venture so.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas,  good master, my wife desired some damsons,

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: And made me climb, with danger of my life.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A subtle knave! but yet it shall not serve.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let me see thine eyes: wink now: now open them:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In my opinion yet thou seest not well.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Yes, master, clear as day, I thank God and

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Saint Alban.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Say'st thou me so? What colour is this cloak of?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Red, master; red as blood.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why, that's well said. What colour is my gown of?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Black, forsooth: coal-black as jet.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Why, then, thou know'st what colour jet is of?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And yet, I think, jet did he never see.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But cloaks and gowns, before this day, a many.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Never, before this day, in all his life.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Tell me, sirrah, what's my name?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas, master, I know not.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What's his name?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: I know not.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Nor his?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: No, indeed, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What's thine own name?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Saunder Simpcox, an if it please you, master.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Then, Saunder, sit there, the lyingest knave in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Christendom. If thou hadst been born blind, thou

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: mightest as well have known all our names as thus to

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: name the several colours we do wear. Sight may

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: distinguish of colours, but suddenly to nominate them

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: all, it is impossible. My lords, Saint Alban here

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: hath done a miracle; and would ye not think his

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: cunning to be great, that could restore this cripple

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: to his legs again?

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: O master, that you could!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My masters of Saint Alban's, have you not beadles in

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: your town, and things called whips?

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Yes, my lord, if it please your grace.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Then send for one presently.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Sirrah, go fetch the beadle hither straight.

speaker: Mayor
text_entry: Exit an Attendant

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now fetch me a stool hither by and by. Now, sirrah,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: if you mean to save yourself from whipping, leap me

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: over this stool and run away.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas, master, I am not able to stand alone:

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: You go about to torture me in vain.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Enter a Beadle with whips

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Well, sir, we must have you find your legs. Sirrah

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: beadle, whip him till he leap over that same stool.

speaker: Beadle
text_entry: I will, my lord. Come on, sirrah; off with your

speaker: Beadle
text_entry: doublet quickly.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: Alas, master, what shall I do? I am not able to stand.

speaker: SIMPCOX
text_entry: After the Beadle hath hit him once, he leaps over the stool and runs away; and they follow and cry, 'A miracle!'

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O God, seest Thou this, and bearest so long?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: It made me laugh to see the villain run.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Follow the knave; and take this drab away.

speaker: Wife
text_entry: Alas, sir, we did it for pure need.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let them be whipped through every market-town, till

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: they come to Berwick, from whence they came.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt Wife, Beadle, Mayor,  and c

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Duke Humphrey has done a miracle to-day.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: True; made the lame to leap and fly away.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But you have done more miracles than I;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You made in a day, my lord, whole towns to fly.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter BUCKINGHAM

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What tidings with our cousin Buckingham?

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Such as my heart doth tremble to unfold.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: A sort of naughty persons, lewdly bent,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Under the countenance and confederacy

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Of Lady Eleanor, the protector's wife,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: The ringleader and head of all this rout,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Have practised dangerously against your state,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Dealing with witches and with conjurers:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Whom we have apprehended in the fact;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Raising up wicked spirits from under ground,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Demanding of King Henry's life and death,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And other of your highness' privy-council;

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: As more at large your grace shall understand.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: [Aside to GLOUCESTER]  And so, my lord protector,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: by this means

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Your lady is forthcoming yet at London.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: This news, I think, hath turn'd your weapon's edge;

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: 'Tis like, my lord, you will not keep your hour.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ambitious churchman, leave to afflict my heart:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sorrow and grief have vanquish'd all my powers;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And, vanquish'd as I am, I yield to thee,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or to the meanest groom.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: O God, what mischiefs work the wicked ones,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Heaping confusion on their own heads thereby!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Gloucester, see here the tainture of thy nest.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And look thyself be faultless, thou wert best.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, for myself, to heaven I do appeal,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: How I have loved my king and commonweal:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And, for my wife, I know not how it stands;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sorry I am to hear what I have heard:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Noble she is, but if she have forgot

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Honour and virtue and conversed with such

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As, like to pitch, defile nobility,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I banish her my bed and company

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And give her as a prey to law and shame,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That hath dishonour'd Gloucester's honest name.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Well, for this night we will repose us here:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To-morrow toward London back again,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To look into this business thoroughly

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And call these foul offenders to their answers

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And poise the cause in justice' equal scales,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whose beam stands sure, whose rightful cause prevails.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt
